org.apache.taverna.activities.rest

Class RESTActivityConfigurationBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.taverna.activities.rest.RESTActivityConfigurationBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class RESTActivityConfigurationBean
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Beans of this class store configuration information for REST activities. Configuration is comprised of the HTTP method to use, URL signature, and MIME types for Accept and Content-Type HTTP request headers. Additional value is used to record the format of outgoing data - binary or string.

    Also, derived attribute "activityInputs" is generated by identifying all "input ports" in the provided URL signature.

    Complete request URL (obtained by substituting values into the placeholders of the URL signature) is not stored, as it represents an instantiation of the activity invocation. The same applies for the input message body sent along with POST / PUT requests.
    Author:
    Sergejs Aleksejevs
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultInstance

        public static RESTActivityConfigurationBean getDefaultInstance()
        Returns:
        An instance of the RESTActivityConfigurationBean pre-configured with default settings for all parameters.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Tests validity of the configuration held in this bean.

        Performed tests are as follows:
        * httpMethod is known to be valid - it's an enum;
        * urlSignature - uses URISignatureHandler.isValid(String) to test validity;
        * acceptsHeaderValue and contentTypeForUpdates must not be empty.

        contentTypeForUpdates is only checked if the httpMethod is such that it is meant to use the Content-Type header (that is POST / PUT only).
        Returns:
        true if the configuration in the bean is valid; false otherwise.
